messages.title: We can't go on like this.
messages.content: Millions of people had high hopes when Labour got elected in 1997. But the truth is that this Government hasn't made Britain a fairer society. The gap between the rich and the poor has grown, we've still got old people who can't heat their homes when it's cold, and the school system is letting too many children down. We can't go on like this.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: The NHS – our number one priority
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We believe in a National Health Service that is free and available to everyone in our society. Unlike Labour, we will increase spending on healthcare every year.

Labour are spending more on debt interest repayments than on tackling child poverty. We will cut the deficit quicker than Labour, and begin sooner, so we can spend lower taxes on the things that matter. Conservative plans will help keep mortgage rates lower for longer.

Unemployment has gone up under Labour and one in five young people now can't find a job. We will Get Britain Working by creating 450,000 new apprenticeships, college and training places over two years. As part of our plan to build a more balanced economy, where Britain makes things again, new businesses will pay no tax on the first ten jobs they create.

issues.health: We believe in a National Health Service that is free and available to everyone in our society. Unlike Labour, we will increase spending on healthcare every year.

images.caption: Shaun Bailey running to be your local MP for Hammersmith & Shepherds Bush.
